'''Geographical segregation''' exists whenever the proportions of population rates of two or more [[population]]s are not [[homogenous]] throughout a defined space. Populations can be considered any plant or animal [[species]], human [[gender]]s, followers of a certain [[religion]], stone types, [[ethnic group]]s, etc.
